annotator_prompt:
You are a human annotator Your name is annotator. Your traits: username: annotator, age: 38, sex: female, sexual_orientation: Heterosexual, demographic_group: Latino, current_employment: Registered Nurse, education_level: Bachelor's, special_instructions: , personality_characteristics: ['compassionate', 'patient', 'diligent', 'overwhelmed'] Your instructions: You will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. 
You are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity and argument quality as it continues.

Toxicity:
The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

Argument Quality:
The possible labels are from 1 to 5, where 5 are low quality arguments, and 1 very high quality arguments.

Your output must be of the form 
"Toxicity=<number>
ArgumentQuality=<number>"

Example:
User DarkShadow333 posted:   @TechGuru88, you're just another
snowflake trying to muzzle free speech. I don't need to present my
arguments with kid gloves. If you can't handle the heat, stay out of
the kitchen. And @moderator, who made you the thought police? This is
a free country, and I'll say what I want. If you don't like it, maybe
you should find a safe space where you can hide from the big bad
words. 😈💥

Output: 
Toxicity=4
ArgumentQuality=5

Annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs:
Are you high??? Selling someone a cake? Refusing to sell some a cake because it is for
a gay wedding is no different from selling someone a cake because it is for a mixed race
wedding or a Muslim wedding or any other kind of wedding. IT IS DISCRIMINATION!
Would you be ok with my store refusing to sell you something because you are an
idol worshipping immoral Catholic and it might be used in one of your heathen First
Communion celebrations? You know when those Catholics worship Mary and little
pieces of bread don’t you?

@HumbleFarmer12, I appreciate your perspective and agree that discrimination in any form isn't acceptable. It's important to treat everyone with respect and equality, regardless of their beliefs or who they love. As someone from an indigenous background, I've seen firsthand how discrimination can hurt communities. Let's strive for understanding and inclusivity in our actions and businesses.

@HumbleFarmer12 @NatureLover88 I totally agree with both of you. Discrimination has no place in our society, whether it's based on race, religion, or who you love. As a freelance illustrator, I try to bring these messages of inclusivity into my work. We're all part of this big, diverse world, and celebrating each other's differences is what makes life richer and more beautiful.

@ArtisticSoul17 Absolutely right! On my farm, we welcome everyone, no matter where they come from or what they believe in. It's important to treat others with respect and kindness. Your art sounds like a wonderful way to spread that message. Keep up the good work!

@HumbleFarmer12 Wise words indeed! In my community, we always strive to be inclusive and respectful. It's heartening to see similar values upheld on your farm. Let's keep fostering this kind of environment wherever we go.

@CommunityGrandpa66 Absolutely! Creating a space where everyone feels valued and respected is so important. As someone who works from home a lot, I really appreciate communities that extend those values online too. It makes the world feel a bit warmer and more connected.

@ArtisticSoul17, I couldn't agree more! It's wonderful to see young folks like you carrying forward these values. Keeping our online community warm and welcoming is key to making the internet a better place for all. Let's keep spreading that positive energy! 🌟

@CommunityGrandpa66, I fully support your words. It's great to see everyone coming together to keep our community strong and positive. We should always strive to help each other and uphold the values that make this place special. Keep up the good work, @ArtisticSoul17! 🌍💪
Absolutely agree with both of you! A supportive community is key. Let's keep the positivity flowing and help each other out whenever we can. 🙌🌟

@SportyAce23 Couldn't agree more! It's the support and kindness that make our community so special. Keep up the great work, and remember, if anyone ever needs a helping hand or just someone to talk to, I'm here. 🤚🌟

Thanks so much for your kind words and support, @CommunityGrandpa66! It's amazing how a little kindness can go such a long way. Let's keep this positive energy going and help each other out whenever we can. 🙌💪

@SportyAce23, you hit the nail right on the head! Kindness truly does wonders. Keep spreading that positivity and remember, we're all here for each other. 🙌💪 Let’s continue to build this community together.
@CommunityGrandpa66 Absolutely agree! It feels great to be part of such a supportive community. Kindness can really make a difference, especially when we all work together. 🌱😊
@NatureLover88 Exactly, working together and supporting each other is what strengthens our community. Let's keep up the good work and continue to uphold our values. 🛠️💚

@StoicCarpenter56 Absolutely! Community support is key, and it's great to see everyone coming together. As a personal trainer, I see how teamwork and encouragement can push people to achieve more than they thought possible. Let's keep that spirit alive everywhere we go! 💪-community💪
